column4: hmm, when you hit alt-ctrl-F2 you end up to commandline, where you can log in and check if X logs have anything interesting, right?
grew impatient; rebooted via button
heh, it could be just overactive screensaver for example, or, buggy driver, or, whatever
looks like black screen upon booting also - ctl-alt-f2 gets me to a text mode login prompt - am looking at xorg log now
great, sounds like just driver issue or so
can't tell from the log what broke
grep EE /vat/log/Xorg.0.log returns what ? pastebin :)
http://rafb.net/p/PmtxOS82.html
btw, lspci says "01:05.0 VGA compatible controller: ATI Technologies Inc RS690 [Radeon X1200 Series]"
ah, interesting
do i have a path forward or is ubuntu just not the distro for this box?
well, whatever the problem is, it's not because of Ubuntu, but I don't know much about ati myself so, hard to say
can you try "vesa" driver ?
i have no idea - install never gave me a choice
you don't need to install vesa driver, it's somewhat "failsafe standard" driver
my xorg.conf looks so generic that it hardly seems usable - doesn't specify *any* driver
heh, so prolly we should add one, hmmm
well, what happened to this whole installation process that handled that?
we now rely on "automagic" which works well in great majority of cases
new Xorg which does things just tad bit better
ok, Xorg -configure gave me nothing useful
so how is this "automagic" invoked?
sorry, but I don't know
am noting http://www.beijinglug.org/en/index.php?option=com_fireboard&Itemid=66&func=view&id=2334&catid=3
